relations.reasons: As people age, they may face similar challenges like an older brother who needs guidance. Marriage involves having a spouse, just like getting married means finding one’s partner. Living on your own (independent) still doesn’t mean you don't need parental supervision. When facing problems at work, seeking advice from those wiser (like parents) will guide you towards making correct decisions. Asking for advice shows humility and willingness to listen, traits often encouraged by parents.

paragraph:
Different types of tasks endow more colors to our life

In my family, the argument topic between my father and mother always involves my father's job. Five years ago, he quitted his 20 years job as an architectural engineer, and became a landscape painter. Every time I asked him why, he will say, seriously," I am done, doing this same work for 20 years and I really want to try some different, that is all." While there are innumerous people will deem it ridiculous and argue doing the same task is the meaning of job, but from my perspective, I am on the side of my father.

Most of workers have adapted to do same task. It allows us to achieve more. As a authoritative dentist in my province, my mother has worked for 25 years. Gandhi devoted his whole life to fight against British-ruled government and inspire movements for civil rights in India, finally he became the father of the nation. These examples make it obvious that great achievement needs someone keen on one task for long time. While when it comes to "happier", different type of jobs can be responsible factor.

components.span: It allows us to achieve more
As a authoritative dentist in my province, my mother has worked for 25 years
Gandhi devoted his whole life to fight against British-ruled government and inspire movements for civil rights in India, finally he became the father of the nation
great achievement needs someone keen on one task for long time
when it comes to "happier", different type of jobs can be responsible factor

relations.reasons: It (team work) allows us to make great achievements. Being keen on one task will help us achieve more.

Being an authoritative dentist is a great achievement. Working for so many years shows being keen on one task over a long period of time. Having authority in your own province takes dedication and hard work over a long time.
Different types of jobs may lead to great achievements. Being keen on one task is a major responsibility factor.

paragraph: Doing different tasks makes employees and employers much happier. Workers, who work for an ordinary company or industry, will be sick of same tasks day by day. Although they can be familiar with their job, changing of job is what serve to their happier. Changing the type of work will be fresh and elicit their potential to adapt a new environment, which, according to psychology theories, makes workers relaxed and happier. To set another example, consider every workers have ability to do several kinds of work, employers will be satisfied by the generating benefits. They both will be happy because the change of job, not the same task day by day.

components.span: Doing different tasks makes employees and employers much happier
Workers, who work for an ordinary company or industry, will be sick of same tasks day by day
they can be familiar with their job
changing of job is what serve to their happier
Changing the type of work will be fresh and elicit their potential to adapt a new environment, which, according to psychology theories, makes workers relaxed and happier
consider every workers have ability to do several kinds of work, employers will be satisfied by the generating benefits
They both will be happy
the change of job, not the same task day by day

relations.reasons: Job change brings happiness. You will feel comfortable when you're familiar with your job.

Doing different tasks allows people to change their job types and environments. When doing something new, one feels happy because they feel refreshed (relaxed). Both employees and workers benefit from changing jobs or adapting to new workplaces. Understanding human behavior through psychology theories also contributes to making both employers and workers happier.

Working in different environments (adapting a new environment) reduces boredom caused by working at an ordinary company/industry. Doing repetitive tasks every day causes monotony (same tasks), while changing jobs brings novelty (fresh). According to psychological theory, adapting to change results in relaxation and happiness.

Being familiar with your job means being able to easily adapt into a new working environment. When people change their job they feel refreshed because they're doing something different. According to some psychology theory, when employees experience changes in their workplace, they tend to relax and enjoy themselves more.

If employees have multiple skill sets, they'll bring value to the company (generating benefits). When people change jobs, they feel refreshed and motivated (freshness), leading to happiness at work (happy workers) due to increased sense of accomplishment through adapting to new environments (adaptability). Employees who experience less stress tend to perform well and contribute positively to an organization’s success (relaxed workers), ultimately resulting in higher employer satisfaction (employers’ satisfaction).

Changing job types may make employees feel relaxed because they're adapting to something new. Being in a new environment could potentially lead to happiness. People tend to find joy when doing things differently.
Having different tasks every day at new jobs keeps employees engaged and motivated leading them to feel happier.

paragraph: Different types of tasks during workday brings more challenges, making life colorful. Just like a song, if I did not have challenge, life would be blue. As an engineering researcher, I will surely be disappointed for failure, and exited for new challenges. New challenges from different tasks amounts far more than more works, it also means through dealing with it, I will obtain more knowledge and experience. As the saying of a Chinese writer, the color of life is rooted not in Japanese cherry blossom or Canadian maple leaf, but rather there always exists new things and challenge. After all, doing same task day and night just server to increase our psychological burden, connecting with different types of job is capable give us more colors to our life.

Doing engineering research provides opportunities to take on various projects and tasks, thus experiencing diverse experiences through working on different types of jobs. Feeling disappointment after facing failures contributes to increasing psychological burdens. Engaging in repetitive activities such as doing the same task every single day results in boredom and dissatisfaction because people crave novelty and variety in their lives.
Dealing with various tasks allows me to connect with diverse jobs. Gaining more knowledge brings more color to my life. Having new experiences may lead to increased psychological burden.

Having various experiences through different types of jobs adds colors to one's life. Doing the same tasks every day creates challenges and burdens psychologically. Challenges bring new things into your life.

paragraph:
Excellent knowledge is better than ability to adopt oneself

With the rapid development of economy, the controversial of good worker's requirement is always in a limelight. From my perspective, there is only one thing would be beneficial to company, and there is only one way to be an outstanding worker, that is possessing excellent knowledge of this job. That's why I believe that the excellent knowledge of this job will be more significant.

Having an excellent knowledge provides long-term benefits even after leaving the job. Long-term jobs require communication rather than working alone. paragraph:
People should create a sense of co-operation in their children

It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:

Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.

components.span: Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently
This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead
MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team

relations.reasons: This factor contributes to confidence. Success often comes after handling difficult situation independently. Children's futures lie ahead.

In an environment where teamwork is emphasized (like MNCs), being overly competitive may hinder one's ability to manage the team effectively. Children who exhibit competitiveness tend to develop confidence in handling independent tasks or situations.

paragraph: However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.

components.span: those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead
they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do
they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team

relations.reasons: Creating a sense of co-operation among children involves teaching them an art of managing different situations in life. Teaching children will lead to making them sensible enough when dealing with various life situations. Making children part of a team teaches them an important skill – the ability to manage different situations in life effectively. When parents teach their kids teamwork, this develops a sense of co-operation within them. An art of managing different situations in life includes being able to handle things on your own or working together as a team. Being sensible enough means having the capability to deal with any kind of situation that comes up in life.

Having no pace means lacking the ability to manage things well like a competitor does. Being competitive involves dealing with various difficult situations in life. Not being eager implies one lacks enthusiasm or interest in living their life fully.

paragraph: In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.

components.span: competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level
it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run
co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team

relations.reasons: Being competitive may lead to being successful over time. Competetive children might perform well initially.

Competitive children tend to be quicker at learning things. Being competitive does not necessarily mean being able to implement new ideas quickly. Cooperative children may come up with creative solutions through teamwork. Competitiveness might hinder creativity due to its focus on speed over innovation.

paragraph: To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.

components.span: people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life

paragraph:

The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. paragraph:
A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money

It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.

components.span: my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income

paragraph: Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.

components.span: Money is undeniably pivotal
ways of earning it is also various
A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself
a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion
Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable

relations.reasons: None

One cannot say if someone achieved their success ethically without knowing what they did to reach there. You need to put effort (hardworking) into your goals to make them happen. Your commitment towards something will lead you closer to achieving your objectives (dedication). If one truly loves doing something then they would do everything possible to excel at it (passion).
One achieves their goals through hardworking. It takes passion to make any social achievements. Being dedicated earns one praise (laudable).

paragraph: More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.

components.span: the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered
Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century
his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind
the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark
judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect

relations.reasons: His achievements benefitting the society make him successful. We judge someone's success based on their income. Being judged as successful means being able to earn enough money.

("Income", "Success aspect") # Reason: High income often indicates success. ("20th century", "Judging a person") # Reason: People's judgement may change over time due to changing values and circumstances. ("20th century", "Income") # Reason: Economic conditions changed significantly during the 20th century affecting incomes. ("20th century", "Success aspect") # Reason: What constitutes'success' changes across different eras including the 20th century.

It is hard to judge someone based on their financial situation because people may spend differently. Knowing how much one spends (utilization) is often hidden or unknown, making judging them harder. Understanding how well they utilize their resources would help us understand if they're successful financially.

paragraph: In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.

paragraph:
Advertising impact on people's choice of consumption

Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.

components.span: people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life

in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs

relations.reasons: An advertisement company uses advertising techniques. Popularity of singers/actors influences people's purchasing decisions. Sales increase when advertisements boost them. Adolescents often make impulsive purchases based on celebrity endorsements rather than actual needs. Fans tend to purchase items endorsed by their favorite celebrities out of loyalty (idols). Buying something just because one likes an actor/singer does not necessarily meet one's real-life needs.

paragraph: In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.

relations.reasons: Advertisements often lead to impulsive buying due to their convincing nature. Products advertised may create false desires among consumers.

People buy things because advertisements convinced them. Advertisements make good ads convincing people. Buying something just because everyone else does means believing what they want without thinking if its really needed or not.

paragraph: However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.

the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy

children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not

relations.reasons: People's buying habits influence their purchase decisions. Advertisements often appeal to our personal preferences.

One's need may influence their response to an ad (advertisement). How much someone consumes something might affect whether they will buy or not. Whether someone buys something also dependes on their ability of consumption.
Buying impulsivey may result from advertisements. Concerns over disposable income affect peoples' behaviors.
People need to allocate their budget when making purchases. Advertisements influence what products consumers choose to buy.
Having no financial pressure allows one to think clearly on necessity. Lack of economic independence may lead people buying things impulsively.

paragraph: In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.

for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising
it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need

relations.reasons: Youngsters who aren't fully mentally developed may fall prey to biased thinking due to advertisements. Advertisements often come from companies like toy manufacturers. Governments regulate industries including those involved in making ads to protect young minds.

paragraph:
Schools should only teach children the academic subject

People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.

components.span: I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program

paragraph: Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job.

components.span: students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics
these subject are necessary for students' future
when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification
the unemployment rate is always high
parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job

relations.reasons: Studying various subjects prepares students for their future careers. Understanding mathematical concepts contributes significantly to one's future career prospects. Familiarity with physical principles also plays an essential role in shaping one's professional path.

In today's competitive job market, one needs strong qualifications. Studying hard under high pressure is required due to intense competition. Meeting certain standards (requirements) demands knowledge of math and science (physics). Strong foundation in academics such as maths and sciences will help qualify candidates in this highly competitive labour market.

Parents influence what their children study. Studying certain subjects may lead to jobs. Academic subjects include mathematics and physics. Students often study math and physics to prepare for careers.
There will be jobs if parents encourage their kids to take relevant courses. If the unemployment rate is high then studying certain subjects may lead to getting employed.

paragraph: Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.

components.span: there are many things much more important than having a job
studying music, art or sports is also very important to students
This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them
to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation
through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills
these subjects might fulfil the students' ability
children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity

relations.reasons: Music discovery develops potential. Developing one's potential involves studying arts. Exploring nature inspires creativity like sports.

("Students", "Job in labor market") # Reason: In order to find jobs after graduation, students need both hard and soft skills including those learned through participation in sports like presentations. ("Understand team spirit", "Soft skills") # Reason: Understanding team spirit involves learning soft skills. ("Learn lesson about teamwork skill", "Hard skills") # Reason: Learning teamwork skills may involve acquiring some hard skills too.
There are other things beyond just getting a job. These subjects help develop one's abilities.
Music, arts and sports are types of subjects. Arts help people express themselves fully (fulfill). Engaging in sports develops physical abilities. Both statements refer to students.

Students need both hard and soft skills to succeed in the labour market. Having soft skills like teamwork enables them to acquire certain abilities through various subjects. Being able to present themselves effectively contributes significantly to their overall ability. Acquiring relevant hard skills via appropriate subjects will help secure jobs in the labour market. Developing teamwork skill allows one to develop other important abilities.
Children's future depends on their own effort and capacity rather than what they studied at school. Studying certain subjects may help fulfill one's potential or abilities.

paragraph: In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.

components.span: the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children
the effects of learning music, sports are profound

paragraph:
Internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines

Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.

components.span: newspapers and magazines will be history with the time
internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news

paragraph: A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.

components.span: A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis
This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly
when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident
The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth
In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media
Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two
digital media will rule over paper and magazines

relations.reasons: Media updates people on current affairs. People take actions based on published information.

Media includes digital media. Publishing current affairs on papers or magazines may take time during crises. During a crisis, people prefer reading news through digital media rather than physical copies like newspapers or magazines.
We want detailed information through digital media when something goes wrong (like the disappearance of MH 370). Newspapers/magazines report on tragic incidents such as plane accidents.
People want digital information because they care about their loved ones (friends and family). Crews and passengers may read papers or magazines during travel.

In emergency situation, newspaper cannot compete with speed of digital media. With rise of digital media, print media like magazine may lose its importance. As people shift towards digital media, demand for printed material (paper) decreases.

People rely heavily on digital media for getting trustworthy information quickly. Online sources provide up-to-date coverage of current incidents, often beating out newspapers and other print-based outlets. As technology advances, readers turn away from physical copies of magazines towards their digital counterparts.

paragraph: People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.

internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details
This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines

relations.reasons: We need to look at the past (small village) to understand what happened during war time. Researchers might find information on Oramaki useful for their study. Events happening before second world war could spark people's curiosity or interest. News articles help us access knowledge about places such as Oramaki. One possible reason why someone would search historical events is because they wish to satisfy their own personal interests.

It's hard to find old newspaper articles without knowing what to search for. People need to access old news for different purposes such as preparing for research or satisfying their curiosity. Knowing beforehand where to look will help people who wish to do some research. There may be several types of information available online that could serve our purpose. Looking into something might spark an interest in someone.
related_key_phrases: Know before where to look at

relations.reasons: Internet's efficient search facility allows people to easily find information including accessing old news. People may need to look up past news using internet's search facilities.
One unique feature of digital media is accessing information from the past. Newspapers and magazines do not support this kind of research. People may read old issues out of curiosity or interest.

paragraph: To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.

components.span: the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider
considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years

paragraph:
Factor of choosing a career.

In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.

there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard

paragraph: To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life. People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary. In this sense, it is also one very salient proof of the accuracy of my position.

components.span: in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well
aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life

("Happiness", "Money")        # Reason: Higher earnings often bring greater sense of fulfillment and joy. ("Quality of life", "Money")      # Reason: Financial stability contributes significantly towards overall standard of living.

paragraph: Further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. In other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. People working on monotonous jobs may find career promotions satisfying. Having a good salary does not necessarily mean receiving credits from management. Feeling dissatisfaction often comes when one's goals (like career advancement) aren't met.

paragraph: In conclusion, I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators, as there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements.

paragraph:
Children from poorer families are more successful in the future life.

According to some people, child who is brought up in less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle with an adult life problems better than who is from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.

To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery. Moreover, these people will not have an access to a good education. As a result, they can be proselytized into bad isms. For example, most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people, because the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash. In this sense, people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms.

components.span: children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery
these people will not have an access to a good education
they can be proselytized into bad isms
most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people
the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash
people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms

relations.reasons: Children who grow up in poverty are often influenced towards criminal behavior. People from lower socio-economic status tend to follow any ideology without questioning its validity.

Terrorist groups often target uneducated people who may fall prey to their ideologies leading them into committing crimes or other bad habits. People coming from poorer backgrounds might lack access to quality education hence they tend to develop bad habits like theft etc.

People with low educational background come mostly from poor family backgrounds. Individuals who lack proper knowledge or education tend to develop negative behaviors like criminal activities. Children growing up in poverty-stricken areas often engage themselves into crimes due to their environment. Poverty breeds crime. Lack of education may lead people towards wrong path i.e., they might indulge in illegal activites.
Lack of access to good education may lead to being proselytized into bad isms. Certain groups of people might be targeted for proselytization.

Better educated people cannot easily fall prey to terrorist groups' propaganda. People without an open-minded outlook tend to believe what they hear or read blindly (brainwashing). Lack of proper education often results in lack of critical thinking leading to being misled by false information.

paragraph: Nevertheless, people who are born in well-off families have access to good education, which will have a positive impact on their later life. Secondly, children from rich families have better skills on how to use money, because they use it a lot of times. Finally, wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child. For instance, many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families.

children from rich families have better skills on how to use money
they use it a lot of times
wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child
many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families

relations.reasons: Many poor people cannot buy expensive medicine because they belong to poorer families. Rich people can pay for their kids' medical treatment using wealth.

components.span: I disagree with the opinion that children who are brought up in less well-of families are, likely, more successful in the future life

paragraph:
Problems and benefits of international tourism

Along with the advancement of long-distance transportation, international tourism has boomed in the last few decades. Some people believe that this has brought more problems than benefits. I disagree with this view.

I admit that tourism can have a negative impact on the natural environment. In order to meet the needs of tourists, local governments are likely to build more facilities and infrastructures around tourist attractions, which may result in the destruction of natural habitats. Tourism also creates more pollution and waste, including growing emission of greenhouse gases, dumped leftovers and overuse of water, power and other kind of energy in luxurious hotels. Based on these grounds, it seems that tourism puts great pressure on ecosystem and local resources, and it should not be encouraged.

components.span: tourism can have a negative impact on the natural environment
In order to meet the needs of tourists, local governments are likely to build more facilities and infrastructures around tourist attractions, which may result in the destruction of natural habitats
Tourism also creates more pollution and waste, including growing emission of greenhouse gases, dumped leftovers and overuse of water, power and other kind of energy in luxurious hotels
tourism puts great pressure on ecosystem and local resources, and it should not be encouraged

relations.reasons: Building infrastructure near tourist attractions affects the environment. Destroying natural habitats results in a negative environmental impact. Governments support tourism development.
Tourism affects the natural environment negatively. Ecological systems are part of the natural environment. Local resources contribute to the natural environment.

paragraph: However, flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of local economy. Holiday makers flocking to other countries are not only bound to spend on tickets of attractions, but also pay for food, accommodation, transportation and entertainment. Both local people and governments can make a large amount of money through these services, and more employment opportunities can be created as well. I also believe the revenue earned form tourism can be used in turn to reduce pollution and protect the environment.

components.span: flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of local economy
Holiday makers flocking to other countries are not only bound to spend on tickets of attractions, but also pay for food, accommodation, transportation and entertainment
Both local people and governments can make a large amount of money through these services, and more employment opportunities can be created as well
the revenue earned form tourism can be used in turn to reduce pollution and protect the environment

relations.reasons: Tourists visiting places buy ticket of attractions leading to flourishing tourism. Spending money on food contributes positively to local economy. People staying at accommodations contribute to local economy. Using transportations within tourist areas help boost up local economy. Engaging in entertainments during holidays supports local economic growth.
Tourism flourishes at places where locals live. Government's economy grows when there is flourishing tourism. More jobs (employment) come up due to flourishing tourism.
Tourism generates income for the local community. Reducing pollution protects the environment. Flouresing tourism contributes positively towards reducing pollution and protecting the environment.

paragraph: Furthermore, the increasing development of tourism is a boon to travelers as well. The provision of direct airlines makes it possible for them to travel conveniently and comfortably. With adequate local facilities and services available, they can spend more of their holidays having fun and relaxing. In addition, both locals and tourists can experience more cultures than ever before, and they can be more open-minded to eliminate preconceptions and deepen mutual understanding among nations.

components.span: the increasing development of tourism is a boon to travelers as well
The provision of direct airlines makes it possible for them to travel conveniently and comfortably
With adequate local facilities and services available, they can spend more of their holidays having fun and relaxing
both locals and tourists can experience more cultures than ever before, and they can be more open-minded to eliminate preconceptions and deepen mutual understanding among nations

relations.reasons: Direct airlines enhance convenient traveling experience. Increased tourism boosts convenience for travelers.
Local facilities enhance tourism. Having fun and relaxation is a benefit to tourists.

Both locals and tourists can experience various cultures through traveling. Being open-minded is beneficial (a boon) when interacting with different people or places. Eliminating preconceptions often comes after experiencing an increase in knowledge or exposure due to travel. Deepening mutual understanding among nations is also considered a positive outcome (boon).

paragraph: In conclusion, the prosperity of tourism can provide benefits for people on a global scale. Although there are some inevitable problems, they are outweighed by advantages and can be tackled if proper measures are taken.

components.span: the prosperity of tourism can provide benefits for people on a global scale
there are some inevitable problems
they are outweighed by advantages and can be tackled if proper measures are taken

relations.reasons: There are advantages when taking proper measures against inevitable problems. Taking proper measures tackles inevitable problems.

paragraph:

paragraph:
The option to work or study from home is advantage or disadvantage

Undoubtedly this is an era of internet which impacts one's personal as well as professional life. The effect is seen more on the developed countries where people choose to work or study from home instead of going to office or university. Some consider this approach to be an advantage while others reject this as a disadvantage. Both the points of views will be discussed in order.

On the one hand, the benefit that professionals or students get by connecting from home is enormous. For one, it helps working people to maintain work life balance. The best example is the new mother who can join her work as well as take care of her baby. People also get the desired flexibility in terms of working hours. For students too, studying from home is an attractive option. They save the travelling time to Universities and utilize that time on their studies. In a busy city like Tokyo, students waste a lot of time in travelling. Thus, the advantages that people enjoy by working or studying from home, are obvious.

People also get the desired flexibility in terms of working hours
For students too, studying from home is an attractive option
They save the travelling time to Universities and utilize that time on their studies
In a busy city like Tokyo, students waste a lot of time in travelling
the advantages that people enjoy by working or studying from home, are obvious

relations.reasons: Many new mothers need to join their work while taking care of babies. It's helpful for working people to maintain work-life balance. Taking care of babies also contributes to maintaining work-life balance.
Saving travel time allows them to study at home. Using saved time effectively is an attractive option for students who want to study from home.

In a busy city, students spend much time on traveling. For students, studying at home is an attractive option because they save travel time. Traveling wastes student's precious study time; hence, studying from home is preferred.
Connecting from home provides numerous benefits. Both professionals and students connect from home like other people do. Many people choose to work or study at home.
Maintaining work-life balance provides several advantages. People who work at home experience similar conditions like those who study at home.
Flexibility at work provides several advantages. Flexible working hours allow employees to work from home.
Studying from home offers similar advantages like working from home. Students benefit from studying at home.

paragraph: On the other hand, one part of the society, has doubt over the productivity of people who prefers to work or study from home. Many employers argue that once an employee works from isolation, he or she spends a lot of time in communication via phone or email with colleagues. This harms an employee's deliverable. Teachers think that students get affected too as they can not clear their doubts in study topics instantly. Due to this they lag in their studies. These factors affect people who work or study from home.

paragraph:
Old and young workers

Throughout human history, the offspring has always proved its stronger adaptability and advancement than its predecessor. This is still true in the industrial society nowadays, where younger workers are preferably employed and promoted rather than over-50 workers. There are three reasons that can explain their unresponsiveness to the modern workplace.

First and foremost, old workers are not a patch on the younger ones for their unchanged paradigm. The old were raised in poverty, probably caused by war, look at the world from a negative and pessimistic point of view. The misery is so ingrained in their mind that they refuse to change, or more precisely, to accept the existence of such modernity. For example, most would rather choose to piece together parts of a machine than have it done by a robot for their disbelief of its efficiency and safety compared with human's capability.

Humans prefer piecing machines because they believe humans' capabilities surpass robots'. People disbelieve in robots due to an outdated belief system (unchanged paradigm).

In other words, that they are aware of their deteriorating health and lack of enthusiasm comes with their taste for monotony and safe ideology. This, by all means, is outweigh by youngsters' adventurousness and bravery. Blatantly seen, success of most companies stems from young people, whose enterprising ideas that catch up with the world is regarded as wind of refreshment.

paragraph:

These machines reduce the physical work done by humans. Some people think that this is a positive development while others believe it to be disadvantageous for humans.Both sides will be critiqued before a reasoned conclusion is reached.

It is felt by many that the usage of machines is harmful for health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. For example, in many institutions staircases are replaced by lifts now a days. People opt for elevators instead of climbing one or two flight of stairs. It is confirmed in a number of researches that daily usage of elevators in workplaces promotes obesity. So this example clearly shows the linkage between using machines and adverse health effects.

paragraph:
Way to reduce the amount of traffic?

Big cities nowadays can be described as melting pots. The problem off traffic overload, caused by overpopulation, has aroused interest of many city planners. It is argued that only if the demand to go out on the street is cut down can we solve the seemingly insurmountable issue of traffic gridlock. However, I have to profoundly disagree for there are still two viable solutions besides besides this way.

First of all, public transport is a key factor to minimize the number of vehicles on the street. Buses and trains have been phased in the streets for quite a long time and have proven themselves the best candidates among all options. Apparently, a bus can carry no less than 30 people, while a train can carry as much as nine or even ten times of that number. Not to mention the fact that highway train is operated underground, which leaves the street above with buses and non-fuel-based vehicles. Together, they will lessen the crowded image in most cities nowadays.

they will lessen the crowded image in most cities nowadays

Reducing traffic congestion minimizes the crowded image in cities nowadays. Using public transport reduces the number of vehicles on streets.

paragraph: Second, rarely do we realize the helpful existence of urban areas. It is believed that if some of the enormous shopping malls or universities were relocated in the commuter belt, the city street would be les burstling and overly-teemed as it is now. As a rule of thumb, huge centers of attention distributed equally in a wide region means that residential areas will come along thus exert less pressure on the public facilities. The city itself will be absolved of enduring the influx of immigrants as well as unemployed people.

Tourism, since its first appearance a long time ago, can be described as a controversial celebrity. Some believe that tourism is attributed to domestic economic distortion, environmental devastation and irrepairable damage to the exploited places. However, I strongly disagree with this misconcept for the two following reasons.

First of all, tourism plays an indispensable role in nurturing the economy in a way it is meant to be. Basically, places of interest often locate in the wilderness areas, of which economy, before their appearance, haven't blossmed yet. Not until the investment of some companies do chains of hotels and services spring up. It will, by all means, attract considerable attention which goes hand in hand with the enormous income for the local residents. In other word, tourism helps divert the local economy to its right direction, which exploit the best out of its own potential.

components.span: tourism plays an indispensable role in nurturing the economy in a way it is meant to be
places of interest often locate in the wilderness areas, of which economy, before their appearance, haven't blossmed yet
Not until the investment of some companies do chains of hotels and services spring up
It will, by all means, attract considerable attention which goes hand in hand with the enormous income for the local residents
tourism helps divert the local economy to its right direction, which exploit the best out of its own potential

relations.reasons: Places of interest attract tourism. Developing places of interest nurtures local economies. Local economies benefit from tourism development. Places of interest contribute to economic growth. Tourists visit wilderness areas.
Companies' investments lead to tourism development. Hotel chains contribute significantly to local economies.

Tourism nurtures the local economy. Exploiting the full potential of tourism means nurturing the economy. Diverting the local economy to its right direction through tourism involves exploiting its full potential.

paragraph: Secondly, even though environmental damage is inevitable, it is not tourism to be blamed for. In order to turn a wilderness into a place of attraction, the planners must have taken the nourishment of the sceneries into thorough consideration. To be precise, for instance, a fortune is spent on trimming the trees, watering the flowers, preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora, in the hope of beautifying the wild. Not to mention ecotourism, a new kind of environment-friendly service, which gives all environmentalists and nature lovers a hand in raising the awareness of people in protecting their coexistent creatures. Because of that, tourism should not be alledged to be notorous for its detriment to the ecological diversity.

it is not tourism to be blamed for

a fortune is spent on trimming the trees, watering the flowers, preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora, in the hope of beautifying the wild

Not to mention ecotourism, a new kind of environment-friendly service, which gives all environmentalists and nature lovers a hand in raising the awareness of people in protecting their coexistent creatures
tourism should not be alledged to be notorous for its detriment to the ecological diversity

relations.reasons: It's environmental damage rather than tourism being blamed for this issue. Being blamed implies something was done inevitably.
Environmental damage affects ecological diversity.

Turning a wilderness into an attractive area may harm the ecosystem's biodiversity. Attracting tourists often harms the environment. Neglecting the natural beauty of a location will cause damage to the local ecology.

Trimming the trees affects the ecological diversity. Watering the flowers causes some kind of detriments. Preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora relates to tourism activities. Beautifying the wild may harm or affect the ecological diversity.
related_key_phrases: Preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora

paragraph: All thing considered, tourism has proven its friendly attitude towards the exploited areas in terms of finance and environmental impact. the combination of tourism and teaching process is highly recommended in pursuit of a harmonial relationship between human and their surroundings

paragraph:
Future information technology: positive or negative?

The appearance of information technology (IT) in the last 20 years has brought about significant developments in life standard as well as work efficiency. However, it is believed that the evolution also proves to be detrimental. In my opinion, there is a likelihood that future developments in IT will put the users at their own expense.

components.span: future developments in IT will put the users at their own expense

paragraph: With the rapid developing pace, IT seems to have turned its users to its slaves. In the past, there used to be World Wide Web or e-mail, but the cyber world now varies form games, online TV shows to means of communication, and probably still keeps going. Such irrisistible temptations drift people from the real world to the unreal ones, resulting in their dependence on technical equipment. What is more, the lack of soft skills attained form outdoor activities will agitate the IT addict, therefore, staying inside with computer and mobile phone will always be the first alternative.

components.span: IT seems to have turned its users to its slaves
In the past, there used to be World Wide Web or e-mail, but the cyber world now varies form games, online TV shows to means of communication, and probably still keeps going
Such irrisistible temptations drift people from the real world to the unreal ones, resulting in their dependence on technical equipment
the lack of soft skills attained form outdoor activities will agitate the IT addict
staying inside with computer and mobile phone will always be the first alternative

relations.reasons: People's reliance on technical devices relates to IT technology. When people rely heavily on something, they may feel like slaves to it. Those who spend too much time online might lose touch with reality (the real world) and enter an 'unreal' one.

People who stay at home using computers and phones might feel like they're being controlled or enslaved by technology. Using computers and mobile phones constantly could make people dependent on them, making them feel trapped or helpless (slaves). Those who prefer staying indoors may also consider themselves an alternative lifestyle choice. Being a slave implies having no control over one's choices, much like those who choose to spend most of their time online without considering other options.

Spending too much time staying indoors may lead to lacking soft skills. Engaging in outdoor activities reduces reliance on computers. Excessive usage of mobile phones contributes to being an IT addict.

paragraph: Future IT has also aroused concern on health issues. The existence of Skype, Viber or Yahoo has notably reduced even the longest distance into one click. As a result, rarely do people go out of their comfot zone, provided with snack and air conditioner, to assemble with others in flesh. Needless to say, their action will make a beeline for obesity, short-sighted, diabetes and other heart-related problems.

components.span: The existence of Skype, Viber or Yahoo has notably reduced even the longest distance into one click
rarely do people go out of their comfot zone, provided with snack and air conditioner, to assemble with others in flesh
their action will make a beeline for obesity, short-sighted, diabetes and other heart-related problems

paragraph: In conclusion, despite the contribution of IT to the society, its effect on the users' independence and prositution should not be out of concern. To my mind, there have to be some alterations before IT has more serious impact on each individual's life.

components.span: its effect on the users' independence and prositution should not be out of concern
there have to be some alterations before IT has more serious impact on each individual's life

paragraph:
Vegetarianism - why some people are choosing to become vegetarian?

Since the dawn of time, human has considered meat as a fundamental protein sources. Meat has served as the main dish in almost every family's meals all around the world. Recent years, however, has seen a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians. Some people claim that this is brought about by the care for animal rights issue, others think it is much beyond that. It is clear to me that people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and relegious aspect.

components.span: people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and relegious aspect

paragraph: Firstly, health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular. Many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxydant which can prevent cancer. This fortifies the fact that a vegetable diet can do good for our health. Although some argue that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources.

components.span: health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular
Many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxydant which can prevent cancer
a vegetable diet can do good for our health
a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake
it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources

relations.reasons: Many researchers study vegetables containing antioxidants. Antioxidants help prevent cancer. Eating vegetables may make people follow a vegetarian diet. Cancer prevention contributes to overall health improvement.

Eating vegetables contributes to overall health. People choose a plant-based diet because they want to improve their health. Being on a veggie diet is becoming increasingly popular due to its numerous health benefits.
Meals without meat often follow a vegetarian diet. A lack of protein intake may hinder health improvements.
Beans serve as an important protein source when there's no meat on your plate. Meals lacking meat may result in insufficient protein consumption.

paragraph: Secondy, relegious beliefs also contributes to a vegetarian diet. Some religion, such as Buddha, believes that animals were human being in their previous life, so eating their meat mean you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings. It is often said that this view is rather unscientific. However, I am convinced that it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind.

components.span: Some religion, such as Buddha, believes that animals were human being in their previous life
eating their meat mean you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings
it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind

relations.reasons: Some religions believe humans used to be animals in past lives. If eating meat means consuming parents' bodies then this would imply they had been alive before (i.e., previously lived). In some belief systems, people who ate other living things were considered cannibals because those creatures could have been reincarnations of family members or friends.
Eating animal products means eating our parents' bodies (sentient being). Following one's religion brings spiritual growth or enlightenment.

paragraph: To sum up, it is evident for me that people choose to become vegetarians for health and religious concern rather than the benefits of animals. However, a meal which is nutritionally balanced is always most recommended.

components.span: people choose to become vegetarians for health and religious concern rather than the benefits of animals

paragraph:
The maintenance of traditional skills and ways of life?

There is no doubt the application of technological developments in some countries will be accompanied with modern skills and new lifestyles. It is argued that these so-called cultural invasions will result in the distinction of national traditions, and there is no need to maintain them. However, from my point of view, what can be expected, is a change of the role of the tradition but not its disappearance from the society.

components.span: what can be expected, is a change of the role of the tradition but not its disappearance from the society

paragraph: It is undeniable that the country's culture is passed down mainly through traditional skills and ways of life. For instance, in Vietnam, many water puppet shows which once demonstrated our seasonal agriculture and communal activities, are today substituted by cinemas and music concerts. This means the young generation can solely get access to their ancestor's early life through books and images, which otherwise would be much more easily absorbed.

components.span: the country's culture is passed down mainly through traditional skills and ways of life
in Vietnam, many water puppet shows which once demonstrated our seasonal agriculture and communal activities, are today substituted by cinemas and music concerts
the young generation can solely get access to their ancestor's early life through books and images, which otherwise would be much more easily absorbed

relations.reasons: Water puppets demonstrate traditional skills. Seasonal agricultural practices reflect way of life. Communal activities involve traditional skills.

paragraph: In tradition, a person should look back at the past, mainly by means of custom handcraft or antique lifestyle, to progress. Understanding why, and how our predecessors survived through thick and thin will probably be invaluable lessons for us today. Also, study form their mistakes helps us accomplish our goal with smooth sailing.

components.span: a person should look back at the past, mainly by means of custom handcraft or antique lifestyle, to progress
Understanding why, and how our predecessors survived through thick and thin will probably be invaluable lessons for us today
study form their mistakes helps us accomplish our goal with smooth sailing

relations.reasons: Understanding the past involves understanding what our predecessors went through. Learning from history (custom handcraft) provides valuable lessons. People who survive hard times often develop unique lifestyles similar to those found in ancient cultures.

Studying from other's mistake help us move forward smoothly (accomplishing goals) like looking back at the past does. Looking back at the past through custom hand craft or antique lifestyle will lead to progress.

paragraph: To sumarize, there should never be any replacement for traditional skills or ways of life. They are the ones that teach, and will teach us to be self-esteem and experienced, which means their preservation throughout history deserve our attention.

components.span: there should never be any replacement for traditional skills or ways of life
They are the ones that teach, and will teach us to be self-esteem and experienced, which means their preservation throughout history deserve our attention

paragraph:
The zoo deserves maintenance and public respect

For a long time, the zoo has been a second home to endangered animals. However, other people believe that the existence of zoos is next to nothing. In my opinion, the zoo deserves maintenance and public respect for two specific reasons.

components.span: the zoo deserves maintenance and public respect

paragraph: First of all, the zoo should be considered as a means of education with regard to providing real and vivid materials for learners. With zoos, pupils will have a chance of observing the habit and unique instinct of, for instance, a lion or a crocodile. At a higher level, it is of university students' benefits to do biological research based on practical statistics and live recordings, which otherwise would not be at hand. This means that the zoos conduce to the acquisition of knowledge at various levels.

components.span: the zoo should be considered as a means of education with regard to providing real and vivid materials for learners
With zoos, pupils will have a chance of observing the habit and unique instinct of, for instance, a lion or a crocodile
it is of university students' benefits to do biological research based on practical statistics and live recordings, which otherwise would not be at hand
zoos conduce to the acquisition of knowledge at various levels

relations.reasons: Zoos provide an opportunity for pupils to observe animals like lions and crocodiles. Zoos serve as educational tools offering valuable learning resources (materials) for students. Observing animal habits provides authentic information on their behavior. Zoos play a role in educating people through interactive exhibits. Visiting zoos allows us to see various species up close, including exotic ones such as crocodiles.

Doing biological research provides educational value. Using live recordings offers real and vivid learning experiences. Applying practical statistics in studying animal behavior may help us understand them better.
Zoos contribute to the acquisition of knowledge through education. Acquiring knowledge is essential for learners.

paragraph: Secondly, the zoo also serve as a means of ecological protection. Nowadays the process of globalisation is accompanied by the encroachment upon natural habitats, which consequently calls for the help of zoos. What is more, the ever-increasing huntings are having a heavy toll on rare and specious species. Only when zoos appear are such distinction-driven animals as: giraffe, panda, koala or leopard provided with their own inaccessible territory.

components.span: the zoo also serve as a means of ecological protection
Nowadays the process of globalisation is accompanied by the encroachment upon natural habitats, which consequently calls for the help of zoos
the ever-increasing huntings are having a heavy toll on rare and specious species

relations.reasons: Zoos protect ecosystems affected by globalization. Encroaching on natural habitats necessitates conservation efforts like those found at zoos. Zoos play an important role in protecting ecology.
Overhunting affects ecological balance thus requiring ecological protection. Zoos help protect endangered species like rare and specious ones.

Zoos protect distinct species like giraffes through providing them an accessible area (in this case, 'inaccessible' was used incorrectly). By creating separate territories within the zoo, they provide ecological protection to those specific animal groups.

paragraph: In sum, the role of zoos towards both human and animals is undeniably indispensable. It is highly recommended that zoos should be seen with different perspective in order to function at their most efficiency.

components.span: the role of zoos towards both human and animals is undeniably indispensable

paragraph:
Languages' extinction, discuss both views

It is true that the increasing number of languages which are at risk of extinction has become one of the most significant issues that many people of today's society are very concerned for. The question whether our government should make an effort to preserve them by investing more money on that minority languages or not is still a debatable one. I personally suppose that no matter how widely they are spoken, every language should be protected from being disappeared.

components.span: no matter how widely they are spoken, every language should be protected from being disappeared

paragraph: There are several reasons why saving regional languages could be seen as a waste of money. Firstly, we need to consider that if the government expands the use scope of that languages, it can be really expensive because educational programmes will need to be given so as to keep young people learning and using them. For example, some certain areas in the Southern Vietnam have been trying to help their secondary school students who are originally from khmer people speak their language beside Vietnamese, so the local government has recently struggled with their costly investments on language teachers, facilities and appropriate materials. Secondly, it is obvious that in many aspects such as communication, trade, cooperation as well as transaction, it will be absolutely easier for the whole society to work together in one language only.

we need to consider that if the government expands the use scope of that languages, it can be really expensive

the local government has recently struggled with their costly investments on language teachers, facilities and appropriate materials
in many aspects such as communication, trade, cooperation as well as transaction, it will be absolutely easier for the whole society to work together in one language only

relations.reasons: If the government expands its use scope, it may lead to wasting money on saving regional languages. It's considered wasteful when expanding something becomes too costly. Wasting money means being very expensive.
Governments may expand educational programs. Using new language tools affects young people's usage. Implementing new technology costs money (expensive).

Teaching languages needs qualified teachers. Learning new language need proper teaching material. Government support education for minority groups like Khmer people. Education facility is needed when learning a foreign language.

paragraph: Despite of the above arguments, i still strongly believe that the government should try to preserve minority languages. This is because language can be seen as much more than just one method of communication. In addition, forming a language must be undergone thousands of years; thus, it deserves to be respected and preserved. Last but not least, language is one of the essential factors creating the differences and unique cutures in the world. Therefore, saving the use of that kinds of languages in this case generally is the most important element of the cultural diversity's preservation.

language can be seen as much more than just one method of communication
forming a language must be undergone thousands of years
it deserves to be respected and preserved
language is one of the essential factors creating the differences and unique cutures in the world
saving the use of that kinds of languages in this case generally is the most important element of the cultural diversity's preservation

relations.reasons: Governments play an important role in shaping our perception of what constitutes'standard' or acceptable forms of language. Preserving minority languages involves understanding their unique methods of communication.
Language deserves respect so governments should preserve them. Governments preserving minority languages means they will remain preserved.

Preserving cultural diversity involves preserving minority languages. Governments play an essential role in supporting language preservation efforts. Preserving minority languages means ensuring their continued existence through various measures such as government support.
Forming a language takes thousands of years; therefore, respect its history. Preserving something means keeping it intact over time (thousands of years).
Languages create different cultures. Preserving culture means preserving its languages. Using languages is an essential part of saving them.

paragraph: In conclusion, although letting languages spoken by ethnic minorities be extinct seems to be very beneficial, it will definitely impact seriously on many other aspects especially in the loss of our cultural heritages.
