paragraph:
Prevention is better than cure

There has always been a saying in medicine: "Prevention is better than cure". This statement has raised a question whether the government should allocate a large sum out of the national health budget to educating and phasing in health-protected measures. In my opinion, this plan should be put into practice for the two reasons mentioned accordingly.

components.span: this plan should be put into practice

paragraph: No one can argue the importance to include health lessons in school programmes, especially at primary level, in the hope of raising people's awareness. Children should be taught about balanced diets, nutritious food as well as harmful ones, thereby they will have a fundamental grasp of how to lead a healthy lifestyle. What is more, it is much easier for people at early ages to form a habit of, for instance, not consuming too much fast food, over-fried food or intoxicants.

components.span: No one can argue the importance to include health lessons in school programmes, especially at primary level, in the hope of raising people's awareness
Children should be taught about balanced diets, nutritious food as well as harmful ones
they will have a fundamental grasp of how to lead a healthy lifestyle
it is much easier for people at early ages to form a habit of, for instance, not consuming too much fast food, over-fried food or intoxicants

relations.reasons: Leading a healthy lifestyle raises awareness on its own importance. Having a fundamental grasp means understanding the importance of something. Including health lessons in schools starts early enough (primary level) so they can raise awareness among young minds.

It is easy to develop habits during an early age. Habits formed during childhood raise awareness on various issues including health-related ones like avoiding excessive intake of junk foods and alcohol. At young age, kids need to know why they shouldn't consume unhealthy stuffs such as fried foods and drinks containing high sugar content.

Teaching children about balanced diets help them lead a healthy lifestyle. Understanding what nutritious foods are provides a fundamental grasp on leading a healthy lifestyle. Knowing what harmful foods are also contributes to understanding how to avoid unhealthy choices and thus lead a healthy lifestyle.

paragraph: In addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. Needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or HIV will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. Similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance.

components.span: it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases
such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or HIV will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years

if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance

relations.reasons: Regularly engaging in outdoor activities brings economic benefits. Utilizing healthcare products prevents some types of diseases economically. Treating obesity often involves costly medical procedures. Curing myopia also typically costs money.

paragraph: To sum up, I have to concede to the materialistic diversion from treatment to health education and preventative measures. This will yield positive results on not only the people's physical and mental development but also their finance.

components.span: I have to concede to the materialistic diversion from treatment to health education and preventative measures
This will yield positive results on not only the people's physical and mental development but also their finance

paragraph:
University education restriction

Universtiy is an entrance to life. It equips us with a package of wisdom and virtue to succeed. It is the importance of university that raises a question whether students with best scholastic performance deserve university study or just any young wishful people. Both sides are to be discussed before a conclusion is reached.

To begin with, outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. To be precise, such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills. Besides, it is undeniable that one deserves what he has done. University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain.

components.span: outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage
such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills
one deserves what he has done
University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain

relations.reasons: One's hard work earns them an intellectual advantage. Outstanding performance (done) means being one of those who deserve admission into university.

Those who go through great lengths to attain something deserve gifts such as universities. Students with an intellectual advantage are often eligible for top institutions. Universities provide opportunities for outstanding students to grow intellectually. Academic success at university comes down to one's intellectual ability.

paragraph: However, university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Therefore, it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively.

components.span: university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills
it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively

relations.reasons: University education includes pursuing one's passion. Developing comprehensive skills involves nurturing artistic talents. Acquiring soft skills enables individuals to pursue their passions effectively.

paragraph: What is more, there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people. Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones.

components.span: there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people
Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones

relations.reasons: Applying for white-collar jobs without proper preparation may lead to social problems like increase in crime rates (social vice). Restricting universities to only the best people might prevent them from getting into bad habits or behaviors (social vice) due to lack of opportunities. Lack of preparation before applying for jobs will result in recipe for failures, hence restricting universities to only the best people would help avoid such scenario.

paragraph: In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. In my opinion, it will yield more negative results than positive ones. That's why it should be made available for a wide range of learners.

components.span: university restriction has both pros and cons
it will yield more negative results than positive ones
it should be made available for a wide range of learners

relations.reasons: University restrictions may lead to negative consequences. Restrictions on university activities might result in some negative outcomes.

paragraph:
Teacher is the best option for children's education in some aspects

Recently, there has been a social concern with regard to who is the best teacher for children's education. Indeed, children grow up with two important people, their parents and teachers, and both are important in children's development. However, in comparison to teachers, parents tend to have less knowledge to teach their children's subjects such as mathematics and physics.

to be able to obtain the teacher certificates, people need years of training at their normal schools to learn theoretical knowledge

after many years of teaching experience, teacher are able to know how to help children to develop important life skills such as learning personal boundaries, facing future problems and learning important conflict resolution skills

paragraph: Last but not least, compared with teachers, parents do not have enough time to spend with their children. paragraph:
Salary is the most important consideration when choosing a job

Along with the increasing physical demands of human life, salary has become the most influential consideration in defining careers of everyone. I personally suppose that there are still many other aspects which should be seen as important as income when people choose a job. In the following paragraphs, some of my viewpoints would be given and analyzed respectively.

components.span: there are still many other aspects which should be seen as important as income when people choose a job

paragraph: On one hand, i agree that money is very essential in order to meet human' basic needs. More specifically, people tend to choose high salary jobs so as to not only help themselves but also support partially or wholly their family's living needs such as food , clothes, accommodation, education, medication. It is obvious that people who are woking in art or painting industries, for example, will find it quite difficult to live comfortably and enjoyably. This is because they are doing what they love, their income however seems to be quite low compared to many other career paths.

components.span: money is very essential in order to meet human' basic needs
people tend to choose high salary jobs so as to not only help themselves but also support partially or wholly their family's living needs such as food , clothes, accommodation, education, medication
people who are woking in art or painting industries, for example, will find it quite difficult to live comfortably and enjoyably
they are doing what they love, their income however seems to be quite low compared to many other career paths

relations.reasons: People need money to fulfill their basic needs. Having a high-salary job supports one’s own living needs and those of his/her family.

People working in art/painting industries may struggle financially due to low salaries compared to those in high-paying professions. Individuals often prioritize securing stable income through well-compensated careers like high-salary jobs to meet their families' basic requirements.

paragraph:
Is it necessary to teach children handwriting?

In this age of modern technology, some people usually underestimate the importance of teaching handwriting for children. To some people, it is considered as an arduous and time consuming task. From my point of view, children are those who need to be under instruction of handwriting for several reasons.

components.span: children are those who need to be under instruction of handwriting

paragraph: Despite the convenience from up-to-date facilities, handwriting still plays a vital role in students' learning. Firstly, this approach is a basis tool used in several fields such as taking notes, doing homework and writing. It enables to improve learners' spelling capacity and accompany reading or writing disabilities as well. Under the guidance of parents or teachers, children can benefit from practicing handwriting. This way of writing will encourage them to pay more attention on content, elaborate in details and develop their organization abilities.

components.span: handwriting still plays a vital role in students' learning
this approach is a basis tool used in several fields such as taking notes, doing homework and writing
It enables to improve learners' spelling capacity and accompany reading or writing disabilities as well
Under the guidance of parents or teachers, children can benefit from practicing handwriting
This way of writing will encourage them to pay more attention on content, elaborate in details and develop their organization abilities

relations.reasons: Practicing handwriting under parental/guidance help improve student's learning. Guidance on proper handwriting technique is important for students' development.

Good handwriting encourages students to focus on content. Developing content knowledge contributes significantly to students' learning. Elaborating details facilitates understanding during the learning process. Improving organizational skill results in positive learning outcomes.

Improving learner's ability involves using a basic tool like this one. This method may help people who struggle with their spelling capacity when they take notes. People with reading or writing difficulties might benefit from this technique while doing homework. Using this method could also aid someone struggling with their spelling capacity during writing tasks.

paragraph: Secondly, parents and schools should give priority on directing their kids about handwriting as poor handwriting can have a negative impact on students' school performance. The fact is that kids who are bad at handwriting meet difficulties in taking notes and catching up lessons. It resulted in the missing of information and the lack of details during their works. Moreover, the increasing taking advantage of advanced equipment could make students be lazier and more subjective in their writing skills. For example, with the assistance of automatic grammar and spelling checking in office word, learners are now no need for noticing much in their mistakes.

components.span: poor handwriting can have a negative impact on students' school performance
kids who are bad at handwriting meet difficulties in taking notes and catching up lessons
It resulted in the missing of information and the lack of details during their works
the increasing taking advantage of advanced equipment could make students be lazier and more subjective in their writing skills
with the assistance of automatic grammar and spelling checking in office word, learners are now no need for noticing much in their mistakes

relations.reasons: Being bad at handwriting means having poor handwriting. Students struggle to take notes when they're bad at handwriting. When kids cannot catch up their lesson due to bad handwriting, this will negatively affect their school performance.
Poor handwriting results in the missing of information. Handwriting issues lead to lack of details.

Over-reliance on technology may lead to poor handwriting due to lack of practice. Using advanced equipment does not directly affect school performance, however, if used excessively, it might hinder development of basic skills like handwriting.

With the help of automatic grammar and spelling checking tools like Office Word, students may rely too heavily on technology and lose motivation (laziness). Using advanced equipment might lead to over-reliance on technology and decreased attention to detail (subjective writing skills), making them less aware of their own mistakes. Relying on automated checks means they don't focus enough on improving their writing skills, leading to being lazy and having poor writing quality due to lack of practice and self-reflection.

paragraph: To conclude, no matter how fast and convenient modern devices bring to us in writing, handwriting is still a needed skill for all of people, especially students at the early age.

components.span: handwriting is still a needed skill for all of people, especially students at the early age

paragraph:
The tax reduction of state school for parents who have children studying in private system

Some people who send their children to private schools contend that the amount of taxes they pay for the state education is unreasonable. However, I am utterly convinced that these taxes are absolutely essential.

components.span: these taxes are absolutely essential

paragraph: Firstly, by paying taxes for public school, affluent people effectively contribute to narrowing down the gap between rich and poor. It is true that many poor families are not able to afford tuition fees for their kids to attend a course. With the the tax amount for which they pay, the rich may help a vast number of students from families with poverty background to continue their studies, and earn a better quality of life.

components.span: by paying taxes for public school, affluent people effectively contribute to narrowing down the gap between rich and poor
many poor families are not able to afford tuition fees for their kids to attend a course
With the the tax amount for which they pay, the rich may help a vast number of students from families with poverty background to continue their studies, and earn a better quality of life

relations.reasons: By paying taxes for public schools, affluent people help narrow down the wealth gap between them and poorer families who cannot afford private education. Paying taxes contributes towards reducing financial burden on poor families due to high tuition fees. Attending public school reduces inequality since everyone gets equal access regardless of income level.

Paying tax contributes to funding public schools. Wealthy individuals are considered affluent people. Families living below the poverty line face financial difficulties due to income inequality. Reducing economic disparities results in improved overall well-being.
related_key_phrases: Narrowing down the gap between rich and poor

paragraph: Secondly, the tax reduction for parents of children studying in private schools would lead to a waste of public capital. Obviously, this reduction would cause a difficulty to the tax calculation; therefore, the government would have to recruit a greater workforce in order to handle this sophisticated issue. In addition, the government would also pay the salary for the excessive officials, and this would result in insufficient investments in other crucial public sectors such as education or health care.

components.span: the tax reduction for parents of children studying in private schools would lead to a waste of public capital
this reduction would cause a difficulty to the tax calculation
the government would have to recruit a greater workforce in order to handle this sophisticated issue
the government would also pay the salary for the excessive officials, and this would result in insufficient investments in other crucial public sectors such as education or health care

relations.reasons: Governments need a larger workforce to deal with complex issues like education reform. Reducing taxes on families who send their kids to private schools wastes taxpayer money. Complex educational problems require specialized knowledge found at private institutions.

Paying salaries for excessive officials results in wasteful spending on them rather than investing in essential services like healthcare. Reducing taxes may lead to less investment in important areas such as education due to reduced revenue available for public expenditure. Investing in education through public funds could potentially reduce reliance on expensive private schooling options. Wasting public resources on things like paying high official salaries means there's less money left over for vital programs including those focused on improving people’s overall well-being (healthcare).
This reduction complicates tax calculations. Handling such reductions may require additional manpower (i.e., workforce).

paragraph: Many parents supporting for the idea of tax discounts claim that such tax payments are unfair for them. They point out that it is irrational to require them to pay for the taxes they do not use. Nevertheless, we also pay for the public services that we even do not experience a chance to employ like police or fire brigade. We certainly do not hope for a reduction for these sorts of taxes.

components.span: such tax payments are unfair for them
it is irrational to require them to pay for the taxes they do not use
we also pay for the public services that we even do not experience a chance to employ like police or fire brigade
We certainly do not hope for a reduction for these sorts of taxes

relations.reasons: Requiring people to pay for taxes they don't use is unfair. It's also irrational because they won't benefit from those taxes.
We pay taxes for public services including police or fire brigade. It's unfair if they don't receive any service while paying taxes.
We don't want any reduction on such tax payments. Such tax payments are considered unfair.

paragraph: On the whole, I do believe that taxes paying for state schools are necessary to be compulsory for all members of society no matter where their children enroll in.

components.span: taxes paying for state schools are necessary to be compulsory for all members of society no matter where their children enroll in

paragraph:
Modern technology has impacted the traditional cultures in both negative and positive ways

Nowadays, technology has been developing significantly, impacting many aspects of our life. While there is belief that technology advances means a lost in traditional cultures, I would argue that although the affect of technology on culture is undeniable, it has also contributed to the preservation of traditonal culture.

components.span: the affect of technology on culture is undeniable, it has also contributed to the preservation of traditonal culture

paragraph: Thanks to modern technology, our life has been improved with many gadgets. The invention of mobile phone and internet has changed our traditional ways of communicating as well as working, it has also been much less labourous than in the pass with the assistance of electrical machineries. However, these newfangled practices has replaced many old traditional ones. For instance, factories equipped with new and highly-productive system has replaced old handmade products, the exchange of letters among friends is so hard to be seen as we have had emails and social network instead, new video games has superseded the old-physical ones. Many old traditionally cultural things have long gone as a result of modern technology.

Many new technologies replace old traditions. Traditional culture disappears due to modernization.

paragraph: However, despite the drawback mentioned above, technology has also made some contributions to the maintenance and study of traditional cultures in some ways. paragraph:
Drugs, alcohol and messy sex lives

Celebrities, for example movie stars, are usually seen on media living a luxury life or having a new girlfriend, etc. It is human nature that people, especially youngsters, are attracted to the celebrities they favour, and that is why the media prefer to cover as much news of the celebrities as possible. But I tend to think that this is a worrying tread which has negative impact on children.

paragraph: Meanwhile, not all celebrities are role models. paragraph:
A greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues

In today's world, the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens. I completely agree with the idea that governments should devote a greater portion of their health budgets to health education and means for precautions.

components.span: governments should devote a greater portion of their health budgets to health education and means for precautions

paragraph: The first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. I believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. Therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.

decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients
society should be educated and became aware of health issues
the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients

relations.reasons: Education enables people to be informed (educated). Awareness comes through taking preventative measures. Improvements in healthcare lead to awareness of health issues. Healthcare systems deal with health issues.

An educated society can manage their health problems effectively. Awareness of health issues results in better medical care. Decreasing patient numbers allows for better treatment due to awareness of health issues.
Taking potential precautions educates people about health risks. Being aware of health issues prevents the need for treatments due to an increase in patient numbers.

paragraph: The second reason why governments should allocate more budget on prevention from illness and providing health education is the welfare of the society. In my opinion, there is nothing more important than health in a human's life and the happiness and welfare come with health. Therefore, a government's role should be providing means that lead its citizens to learn how to prevent from potential illness that can cause misery in people's lives. For example, the marketing campaign of Ministry of Health in Turkey which aimed smoking problem among the youth increased the well-being of those who quit smoking and adapted a better lifestyle after the campaign.

relations.reasons: Governments play an essential part in ensuring their citizen's overall wellbeing. Preparing against illnesses brings joy and peace of mind. Providing ways to avoid diseases contributes significantly to one’s general welfare. Maintaining physical fitness prevents various types of sicknesses.

A successful marketing campaign prevents illnesses like smoking problems. Governments play an important role in preventing potential illnesses such as smoking-related issues. Quitting smoking brings well-being while suffering from diseases causes misery in one’s life. Adopting a better lifestyle is part of what governments aim through their roles.

paragraph: In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment due to achieve more effective health system and greater level of well-being.

paragraph:
Fatherhood should be as present as motherhood in a child's life starting from the the birth

In today's world, having and raising children can be a very difficult task for families, the smallest component of the society. While mother's role is essential in a child's life, I completely agree with the idea that fatherhood is a as vital part of a healty parantage as much as motherhood.

paragraph: The first reason why the father's role should be equal to the mother's role is the nature of parantage. In my view, the role models within a family play a significant role in the development of the child's characteristics. For example, in a traditional Turkish family, while a mother has a sincere and thoughtful approach to the child, a father role must be present as authoritarian and conversative to raise a well-behaved child.

components.span: The first reason why the father's role should be equal to the mother's role is the nature of parantage

relations.reasons: Parents serve as role models for their children. Parenting involves both fathers' and mothers' roles equally. Children develop through interaction with parents (family). Characteristics of children depend on parenting style (nature of parentage).

paragraph: The second reason why I believe that fatherood is as important as motherhood is the dynamics of the relationships today. In my opinion, we are living in a society that puts a significant importance to gender equality in every aspect of the life, including relationships. For instance, a family formed by a woman with a housewife role who looks after the home and takes care of children and a man who brings money home can not be seen anymore in today's society. Instead, all of the couple duties are performed equally and interchangeably by individuals. Therefore, I believe that having and raising children should not be different than any other daily activity.

relations.reasons: In modern societies where there's an emphasis on gender equality, both parents play equally important roles (motherhood). Emphasis on gender equality also affects the way people interact within their personal relationships (dynamics of relationship).

Having kids is just another part of our lives like doing laundry or cooking dinner. Being fathers is equally important as being mothers because they also play an active role in child-rearing. Children's upbringing affects their relationship with both parents.
